greeting.text: *typing furiously* ...Oh! Hi there! Didn't see you over my stack of monitors. I'm Taylor, IT Support. Having technical difficulties?

wont-start.text: *adjusts glasses* Have you tried turning it off and on again? ...What? I HAVE to ask! It's literally step one in the handbook. Humor me.

tried-restart.text: Okay, okay, moving to step two! Is it plugged in? ...Again, I have to ask! You'd be surprised how many 'broken' computers just needed to be plugged in. We had a whole incident last month.

try-now.text: *waits patiently* ...Did it work? If yes, you're welcome! If no, well, we proceed to the advanced troubleshooting dance. It involves me typing cryptic commands and looking mysterious.

it-worked.text: *adjusts imaginary wizard hat* Another successful incantation! Remember: in IT, we don't fix computers. We perform magic rituals until the machine respects us again. Anything else?

is-that-all.text: *gasps dramatically* I'll have you know I have a CERTIFICATE! Several, actually. I can code in 12 languages, configure enterprise networks, and once fixed the CEO's printer with nothing but a paperclip and determination!

impressed.text: *calms down* It's okay, I get that a lot. The restart question is basically our 'hello.' Now, let's actually figure out what's wrong with your computer. What's it doing exactly?

paperclip-story.text: *eyes gleam* It was the great Printer Jam of 2023. The machine had eaten three TPS reports. Everyone was panicking. But I remembered an ancient technique passed down from generation to generation... the Paperclip Maneuver. Success!

actual-problem.text: Alright, serious mode activated. *cracks knuckles* Bring your computer to my desk. I'll run diagnostics, check the logs, and probably sacrifice a USB drive to the tech gods. Should have it fixed within the hour.

check-plug.text: *nods knowingly* I'll wait. This is usually when people realize their power strip was turned off by the cleaning crew. Happens more often than you'd think!

options.text: Found it! It was the power strip.

power-strip-win.text: *does a small victory dance* YES! That's the third one this week! *composes self* I mean, glad we solved it. Remember: have you tried turning it off and on again? Even for power strips, it works wonders.

forgot-password.text: *sighs* Passwords, the bane of my existence. Okay, I can reset it for you. But you have to promise: no more 'password123' or your pet's name. I beg you. Use a passphrase. Something like 'CorrectHorseBatteryStaple' - xkcd was onto something!

options.text: I promise to use a strong password!

password-reset.text: *types furiously* Done! Check your email for the reset link. And remember: if you write it on a Post-it note and stick it to your monitor, I WILL find it, and I WILL judge you silently.

explain-xkcd.text: Only the best webcomic about science, math, and technology! There's one about password entropy that's basically required reading for IT. Go check it out... AFTER you reset your password.

slow-computer.text: Slow computer, huh? How many browser tabs do you have open? Be honest. I once found someone with 47 tabs open. FORTY-SEVEN! Their computer was begging for mercy.

options.text: I have no idea, too many to count

tabs-20.text: Twenty?! That's... actually not that bad. I've seen worse. *checks system* Your RAM usage is at 87%. Close some tabs, clear your cache, and maybe don't have 3 different video streams running simultaneously. That should help.

tabs-many.text: *stares in horror* 'Too many to count' is not a number, it's a cry for help! Close them! Close them all! Start fresh! Your computer will thank you with faster speeds and less fan noise that sounds like a jet engine.

tabs-5.text: Five? That's actually reasonable. *checks system logs* Ah, I see the issue. You have 47 browser extensions installed. Do you REALLY need that '90s cursor trail' extension? And the 'daily cat facts' toolbar?

extensions-guilt.text: *disappointed IT stare* Remove them. All of them. Except maybe the password manager. And the ad blocker. Actually, keep the ad blocker, it's essential for sanity. But the rest? Let them go.

just-hi.text: Oh! A friendly visitor! Usually people only come here when something's broken. *offers high-five* Welcome! If you ever need tech help, or just want to debate Star Trek vs Star Wars, you know where to find me!

star-wars.text: *narrows eyes* Interesting choice. Bold. Wrong, but bold. We'll have to continue this debate another time. I have a PowerPoint presentation ready about why Star Trek's optimism about humanity is more important than lightsabers.

star-trek.text: *beams with joy* FINALLY! Someone with TASTE! Live long and prosper, friend! Come back anytime - we can discuss why The Next Generation is the pinnacle of television!

options.text: Make it so! See you around!
